title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5319.38 - RNG seeding
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5319.38 - RNG seeding

State Regulations

The first seed shall be determined randomly by an
uncontrolled event. After every game there shall be a random change in the RNG
process (new seed, random timer, delay, etc.) in order to ensure that the RNG
does not start at the same value every time. It is permissible not to use a
random seed. Nevertheless, a manufacturer shall ensure that multiple games will
not synchronize. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5319.38

Adopted

New

York State Register November 16, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 46, eff. 11/16/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
